description: Least positive integer k for which (b+1)^k is not palindromic in base b, b = 2, 3, 4, ...
comments: Sequence of run lengths is C(n,[ (n-1)/2 ]) (= A037952), n=1,2,3,...; sequence of b where a(b) != a(b-1), b >= 3, is C(b-1,[ (b-1)/2 ]) (= A001405).
example: The 4th term is 4 because base 5 representations of (5+1)^1 = 11, (5+1)^2 = 121, (5+1)^3 = 1331, are all palindromic, while (5+1)^4 = 20141 is not.
mathematica: palq[x_] := x == Reverse[x] Table[x = 0; While[palq[IntegerDigits[(t + 1)^x, t]], ++x]; x, {t, START, FINISH}] (* _Dylan Hamilton_, Aug 15 2010 *)
